abstract: Teenager Lydia Ko, who became youngest women's world No 1 golfer in January, is likely to secure Vare Trophy, awarded to player with lowest season stroke average; peers and fans alike speak highly of Ko's charisma, poise and playful nature.
lead_paragraph: With a successful defense of her Tour Championship title, Ko on Sunday can secure the Vare Trophy, awarded to the player with the lowest season stroke average.

headline.main: Both Poised and Playful, Lydia Ko Finds Her Winning Balance
headline.print_headline: Both Poised and Playful, an 18-Year-Old Finds Her Winning Balance

snippet: With a successful defense of her Tour Championship title, Ko on Sunday can secure the Vare Trophy, awarded to the player with the lowest season stroke average.
